content: my baker s hat by em knits materials 150 yards worsted weight yarn i used berroco ultra alpaca in tiger s eye mix & moonshadow us #6 / 4mm 16 circular knitting needles and double pointed needles darning needle stitch markers gauge 20 sts & 27 rounds / 4 in stockinette sizing adult 7 5 tall & 8 5 unstretched circumference to fit 19 - 22 head abbreviations k - knit p - purl dpns- double pointed needles this hat was created for my co- cast on pm - place marker boyfriend to keep him warm on sm- slip marker those chilly early mornings decrease - decreased heading to the bakery the fold-up st s - stitch es brim is knit in 1x1 ribbing with a ssk - slip 1 stitch knitwise slip the singular knit row to make a tidy next stitch knitwise then knit them together fold and it s finished with a k2tog - knit 2 stitches together beautiful square decrease my baker s hat by em knits instructions co 92 sts pm and join for working in the round being careful not to twist the stitches brim k1 p1 around for 3 knit 1 round p1 k1 around for 2 body knit around until hat measures 8 5 from cast-on edge decrease switch to dpns when there are too few stitches to work comfortably around set-up round k1 k2tog k18 ssk pm around 8 sts decrease markers now separate the crown into 4 equal sections round 1 knit around slipping markers as you come to them round 2 sm k1 k2tog knit to 2 sts before marker ssk around 8 sts decrease repeat rounds 1 & 2 until 12 sts remain finishing cut yarn leaving an 8 tail and thread through the remaining 12 stitches weave in ends and block lightly let s connect @em knits #mybakershat emknitz@gmail com
